# resumeExecution(withResult:)

**Instance Method**

If a successful, unmatched, invocation of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/suspendExecution()] has been made, resume the execution of the command.

## Declaration

```swift
func resumeExecution(withResult result: Any?)
```

## Discussion

Resumes the execution of the command if a successful, unmatched, invocation of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/suspendExecution()] has been made—otherwise, does nothing. The value for `result` is dependent on the segment of command execution that was suspended:

- If [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/suspendExecution()] was invoked from within a command handler of one of the command’s receivers, `result` is considered to be the return value of the handler. Unless the command has received a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/scriptErrorNumber] message with a nonzero error number, execution of the command will continue and the command handlers of other receivers will be invoked.
- If [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/suspendExecution()] was invoked from within an override of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/performDefaultImplementation()] the result is treated as if it were the return value of the invocation of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/performDefaultImplementation()].

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/resumeExecution(withResult:)] may be invoked in any thread, not just the one in which the corresponding invocation of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/suspendExecution()] occurred.



## Suspending and resuming commands

- **suspendExecution()**: Suspends the execution of the receiver.
